$${{p}\choose{k}} = \frac{p!}{k!(p-k)!}$$

$${{5}\choose{2}} = \frac{5*4*3*2*1}{2*1*(3*2*1)} = \frac{5*4}{2*1} = 10$$

$$\sum_{k=0}^p {{p}\choose{k}} = \sum_{k=0}^p \frac{p!}{k!(p-k)!} = 2^p$$
$$2^{10} = 1024$$

## slide

$$
1 + \sum_{k=0}^{p-1} (p-k) = 1 + \frac{p(p+1)}{2}
$$
$$ 1 + \frac{10(11)}{2} = 56$$
